description: Lawful evil
name: Alignment

description: ù Geryon was once Lord of HellÆs Fifth Layer. During a period called the Reckoning, Asmodeus himself ousted him. This turn of events seems strange to those who know the facts, since the Reckoning came about when the lords of Hell all turned on their master, Asmodeusùall but Geryon, that is. The only loyal lord was deposed, while most of the mutinous lords went unpunished. Some speculate that this move repre- sented some sort of strange reward from Asmodeusù Geryon certainly did not see it that wayùand others assume the former archdevilÆs loss of rank is only tem- porary. If Geryon has his way, the latter estimation will prove correct. Although some call him the Serpentine Lord, GeryonÆs enemies also name him Lord of the Filth. This label obviously plays off his former ôLord of the Fifthö title, much like BaalzebubÆs ôLord of the Flies/Lord of the Liesö moniker. However, such a reference is ironic in GeryonÆs case, for the archdevil despises uncleanli- ness and dirt, demanding that servants keep himself and his surroundings immaculate. This need seems at odds with the devilÆs otherwise bestial appearance and nature; some think him a little mad. The archdevil dwells in a secret iceberg fortress called Citadel Coldsteel that floats in a frigid sea. Its dangers combined with its sterile appearance encour- age the few who have seen it to compare the place to a surgeonÆs scalpel. In appearance Geryon resembles MammonÆs current form: that of a huge serpent with a muscular humanoid torso sporting two large arms and a massive humanoid head. For all his bizarre appearance, GeryonÆs face and
name: Advancement
